Class Maze

java.lang.Object
  Maze

public class Maze
extends java.lang.Object

Contains the board of the maze. It contains the maze-generating algorithm and the maze solving algorithm. All information about where the player and enemies are are also stored in the maze.

Author:
Gavin Tam
See Also:
Tile, Player, Enemy, MazeGenerator

Maze

public Maze(int w,
            int h,
            Player p)
Constructor for the maze.

Parameters:
w - the width of the maze.
h - the height of the maze.
p - the player of the maze.
Method Detail

showMaze

public void showMaze()
Displays ASCII form of basic maze. Shows where walls and paths are, and where player is.

findPath

public boolean findPath(int x,
                        int y,
                        boolean[][] visited,
                        java.util.HashMap<Tile,Tile> parent)
Finds the path from (x,y) to the destination. It stores the path in an input hash map, which maps the tile to its parent tile. Credit to http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maze_solving_algorithm. Adapted from "Recursive algorithm".

Returns:
true if a path exists. It should be true as the maze is always solvable from any position.

findPath

public boolean findPath(int x,
                        int y,
                        int x1,
                        int y1,
                        boolean[][] visited,
                        java.util.HashMap<Tile,Tile> parent)
Finds the path from (x,y) to (x1,y1). It stores the path in an input hash map, which maps the tile to its parent tile. Credit to http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maze_solving_algorithm. Adapted from "Recursive algorithm".

Returns:
true if a path exists. It should be true as the maze is always solvable from any position.

giveHint

public java.util.List<Tile> giveHint(Tile t)
Give first 10 steps from the current tile to the destination. If less than 10 steps away, all tiles to destination are shown

Parameters:
t - the current tile
Returns:
the list of 10 tiles in the path from the current tile to the destination, or all tiles to destination if less than 10 tiles away.

getPlayerTile

public Tile getPlayerTile()
Finds the tile on the maze that the player is situated in.

Returns:
the tile in which the player is on, or null if player is dead

getEnemyTile

public Tile getEnemyTile(int i)
Finds the tile on the maze that the enemy is situated on.

Parameters:
i - the ID of the enemy (ith enemy).
Returns:
the tile in which the enemy is on, or null if enemy is dead or doesn't exist.

isEnemyTile

public boolean isEnemyTile(Tile t)
Checks if a tile is one where an enemy is situated on.

Parameters:
t - the tile of interest.
Returns:
true if the tile is one where an enemy is situated on.

getDestDoor

public Tile getDestDoor()
Get the tile where the destination door is situated on

Returns:
the tile where the destination door is situated on

updatePlayerLoc

public void updatePlayerLoc(int x,
                            int y)
Updates the player location if a valid move is taken. See isValid() for conditions.

Parameters:
x - the amount of movement in the x direction, as per number of tiles. The number is negative if the movement is to the left direction.
y - the amount of movement in the y direction, as per number of tiles. The number is negative if the movement is to the up direction.

playerDied

public boolean playerDied()
Checks if a player is dead. A player is dead if it encounters the enemy without a sword.

Returns:
true if the player is dead.

enemyDied

public boolean enemyDied(int i)
Checks if an enemy is dead. An enemy is dead if it encounters the player who has a sword.

Parameters:
i - stands for ith enemy
Returns:
true if the enemy is dead.

allEnemyDied

public boolean allEnemyDied()
Checks if all enemies in the maze are dead.

Returns:
true if all enemies in the maze are dead.

getNumEnemies

public int getNumEnemies()
Get number of enemies in the maze initially

Returns:
the number of enemies in the maze initially

isValid

public boolean isValid(int x,
                       int y)
Checks if a player move is valid. The player can only move one tile from its original position in either direction. It cannot move over the border of the maze, or walk onto a wall.

Parameters:
x - the amount of movement in the x direction, as per number of tiles. The number is negative if the movement is to the left direction.
y - the amount of movement in the y direction, as per number of tiles. The number is negative if the movement is to the up direction.
Returns:
true if the player move is valid.

checkReachedEnd

public boolean checkReachedEnd()
Checks if the player has reached the destination. The destination is the tile right before the exit door. If the key is collected, then the door is unlocked as well; otherwise, it remains closed. To check if the player takes the exit, see exitedMaze().

Returns:
true if the player has reached the destination.

atStart

public boolean atStart()
Checks if the player is at the origin. The origin of the maze is at (1,1), just in front of the entrance door.

Returns:
true if the player is at the origin.

exitedMaze

public boolean exitedMaze()
Checks if the player has completed the maze. It is completed when the destination door is opened by the key and the player is located on the exit, where the door was originally positioned.

Returns:
true if player has completed the maze.

getNumTreasureCollected

public int getNumTreasureCollected()
Get number of treasure collected.

Returns:
the number of treasure collected

itemCollected

public boolean itemCollected(int itemNum)
Check if item is collected.

Parameters:
itemNum - the ID of the item as defined in Player
Returns:
true if item is collected

getTile

public Tile getTile(int x,
                    int y)
Get the tile of a specific set of x and y coordinates. (0,0) is the top left corner of the maze (includes border). If a set of coordinates outside of the bounds of the maze is entered, the null tile is returned.

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate of the tile.
y - the y coordinate of the tile.
Returns:
the tile with the specified x and y coordinates, or null if the coordinates are outside of the maze area.

getWidth

public int getWidth()
Get the width of the maze (including border).

Returns:
the width of the maze, as per the number of tiles.

getHeight

public int getHeight()
Get the length of the maze (including border).

Returns:
the length of the maze, as per the number of tiles.

getGrid

public Tile[][] getGrid()
Gets the grid of tiles of the maze.

Returns:
the grid of tiles of the maze.
